title: Skill Metadata
description: Metadata schema for individual metadata.yaml files (Phase 0B). Identity (name, description) comes from SKILL.md frontmatter. This file contains relationship, catalog, and CLI display data.

category.description: Category this skill belongs to (framework, state, styling, etc.)

category_exclusive.description: If true, only one skill from this category can be active. Defaults to true.

author.description: Author handle with @ prefix (for community contributions and display)

version.description: Integer version of the skill (1, 2, 3, etc.). NOT semantic versioning.

cli_name.description: Short display name for CLI (combined with author as 'React @vince')

cli_description.description: Brief description (5-6 words max) for CLI display

usage_guidance.description: When an AI agent should invoke this skill (decision criteria)
examples: Use when building React components, hooks, or following React 19 patterns.
Use when managing global UI state, replacing Context misuse, or handling cross-component state.

requires.description: Hard dependencies - skill IDs or patterns that must be present

compatible_with.description: Soft recommendations - skills this works well with

conflicts_with.description: Mutual exclusions - skills that cannot coexist with this one

tags.description: Tags for discoverability in the marketplace

requires_setup.description: Setup skills that must be completed before using this skill. Used by usage skills to link to their setup prerequisites.

provides_setup_for.description: Usage skills that this setup skill provides initial configuration for. Used by setup skills to link to their corresponding usage skills.

SkillCategory.description: Valid skill category names. Must be one of the allowed values.

SkillReference.description: Reference to a skill ID (e.g., 'frontend/react (@vince)') or pattern (e.g., 'framework/*')
